snippet: South Carolina moved closer to acknowledging the futility of oppressive immigration laws when it abandoned key parts of its harsh law.
abstract: Editorial welcomes South Carolina's move to abandon key parts of its harsh immigration law, including making it a crime to harbor or transport unauthorized immigrants; asserts state has moved closer to acknowledging futility of oppressive immigration laws and urges other states, and Congress, to follow its lead.
lead_paragraph: South Carolina moved closer to acknowledging the futility of oppressive immigration laws when it abandoned key parts of its harsh law.
